Listen: In “The Road to Accountable AI,” Kevin Werbach helps listeners navigate AI hype and implementation

Kevin Werbach, Wharton Professor and Chair of Legal Studies and Business Ethics, has analyzed emerging technologies for thirty years, and created one of the first business school courses on legal and ethical considerations of AI in 2016. In the first 10 episodes of his new podcast – The Road to Accountable AI – Werbach brings this extensive business and development experience to considering responsible AI implementation, with a series of experts in business, data privacy, risk management, technology, healthcare, and policy.

In a new episode, “Effective and Accountable AI in the Public Sector,” Werbach is joined by Director of the Burnes Center for Social Change, Beth Simone Noveck, to discuss the transformative power of AI in public governance. 

Noveck reveals how AI is revolutionizing government operations, from rewriting complex unemployment insurance letters in plain English to analyzing call data for faster responses. In the episode, they discuss New Jersey's innovative use of generative AI to cut response times in half, “empowering public servants to better serve their communities while balancing ethical considerations and privacy concerns.”

Check out The Road to Accountable AI, anywhere you get your podcasts.
